  physical_appearance: The image shows a sari. It is rectangular in shape. It is predominantly maroon in colour
 with yellow borders at the left hand side and at the top and bottom of the garment. There are patterns of flowers and birds along the yellow bands. Checked patterns can be seen all over the maroon region of the garment. Red tassels extend from the left hand side of the garment.

  subject_terms_1: womenswear checker pattern floral patterns birds (motifs) folk costume allover patterns

  subject_terms_2: Women\u0027s clothing Motifs Saris Ethnic costume

  subject_terms_3: Indian costumes

  sgcool_label_text: The sari is a traditional pan-Indian drape
 woven in various parts of the sub-continent. Kanchipuram in Tamil Nadu
 an illustrious weaving centre
 is renowned for the “Kanchivaram Silk Sari”
 worn during special occasions as well as by Tamil brides. This collection of saris were donated by Dr.R.D.Gangatharan in memory of his mother
 the late Lakshmi Rangasamy Davar. Lakshmi Rangasamy Davar
 was a woman pioneer – she was an educationist
 musician and philanthropist.

metadata.physical_appearance: The image shows a sari. It is rectangular in shape. It is predominantly maroon in colour, with yellow borders at the left hand side and at the top and bottom of the garment. There are patterns of flowers and birds along the yellow bands. Checked patterns can be seen all over the maroon region of the garment. Red tassels extend from the left hand side of the garment.
metadata.subject_terms_1: womenswear checker pattern floral patterns birds (motifs) folk costume allover patterns
metadata.subject_terms_2: Women's clothing Motifs Saris Ethnic costume
metadata.sgcool_label_text: The sari is a traditional pan-Indian drape, woven in various parts of the sub-continent. Kanchipuram in Tamil Nadu, an illustrious weaving centre, is renowned for the “Kanchivaram Silk Sari”, worn during special occasions as well as by Tamil brides. This collection of saris were donated by Dr.R.D.Gangatharan in memory of his mother, the late Lakshmi Rangasamy Davar. Lakshmi Rangasamy Davar, was a woman pioneer – she was an educationist, musician and philanthropist.
